person:biography.personal-details:content: Graduated in Electrical and Computer Engineering at the Faculty of Engineering of the University of Porto (FEUP) in 1989, with a specialisation in Control Systems. Worked in industrial electronics, factory and building automation projects and became technical director of a manufacturer of electrical equipment, with voting seat at the national electrical standards committees. Gained scholarships from FCT (Portugal’s Foundation for Science and Technology) to study at the University of York (UK), completing an MSc in Music Technology (Dept. of Music and Electronics) in 1997 and a PhD (Dept. of Electronics) in 2003 on room acoustic modelling. Moved back to Portugal and became a lecturer at the Department of Electronics, Telecommunications and Informatics(DETI) of the University of Aveiro. Main current research interests are acoustic modelling, audio signal processing and auralisation.
